If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.32-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70280 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jdsoijsdoijsojsdoijs@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Create at least 16 unreported expenses in self DM. - One of the unreported expenses has amount in thousand (eg, 2000.00). 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an empty report in workspace chat. 4. Click Add expense > Add unreported expense. 5. Click on the search field. 6. Enter 2000. ## Expected Result: The expense with the amount 2000.00 will show up in the search result. ## Actual Result: The expense with the amount 2000.00 does not show up in the search result when searched with 2000. It only shows up when user searches with 2,000 instead. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a533aefc-91bc-49e5-8e6b-6fc2eae9d969 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Create another expense ## Expected Result: New expense will be created without issue after disabling Add approvals and Make or track payments and changing Submission frequency to Instantly ## Actual Result: Error shows up when creating new expense after disabling Add approvals and Make or track payments and changing Submission frequency to Instantly ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.32-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1305/folder/13176688/52080502/955759034 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** htad26+eriuiyui@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 10/Chrome **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Preconditions User A and User B already have a chat history 1. As User A, ensure the currently opened chat screen is not the chat report with User B 2. As User B, send a message to User A's chat report 3. As User A, wait until the message has been received 4. As user A, open the browser's Network tab > Filter the network traffic for the /ReadNewestAction 5. As User A, navigate to User B's chat report ## Expected Result: Only a single instance of the /ReadNewestAction API call is initiated for the chat report ## Actual Result: Duplicate instances of the /ReadNewestAction API call are initiated for the chat report ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d18f9fd0-4212-4f8c-a973-27eee1144bb3 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.32-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs ](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1760551509709109) ## Action Performed: 1. Set up accountB as a copilot 2. Go to Reports > Submit 3. Go to Settings > switch to accountB 4. Click the Reports page tab 5. Observe the from: in the query doesn’t update 6. Click on the Reports suggested search > then click on Submit suggested search 7. Observe the from: in the query updates ## Expected Result: When switching to another account via Copilot, the query filters (e.g., from:) should automatically update to reflect the newly active account immediately upon switching — without needing to reselect the search. ## Actual Result: After switching accounts, the “Submit” query lingers with the previous account’s filter until a manual interaction (reselecting the search) occurs. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Report - "Submitted" system message doesn´t appear while offline, but "Reopened"  does.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.32-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1306/folder/13176741/41237131/955759332 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1930@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. Prerequisite 2: Delayed submissions enabled and approvals disabled. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Turn off internet connection. 4. Create a manual expense. 5. Open the report of the just created expense. 6. Tap on "Submit" 7. Note that "Submitted" system message doesn´t appear on report. 8. Tap on "More" and select "Retract" 9. Note that a "Reopened" system message appears on report. 10. Turn on internet connection. 11. Note that now, "Submitted" message, appears above "Reopened" ## Expected Result: When an expense is submitted while in offline mode, a grayed out "Submitted" message, should appear on report. ## Actual Result: When an expense is submitted in offline mode, "Submitted" system message doesn´t appear on report, but if expense is retracted, a grayed out "Reopened" system message appears. When recovering internet connection, "Submitted" system message appears above "Reopened". ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/050de118-7de8-4d78-a541-67b2e0e8c4cc [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.32-0-staging **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72572 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome | Samsung A15, Android 15 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a + 3. Choose Track and budget expenses. Complete the onboarding flow. 4. Create a workspace. 5. Go to more features, toggle on Invoices 6. Go to Invoices 7. Click on Add bank account ## Expected Result: After validating the bank account, the user should be prompted to change the account currency. ## Actual Result: No prompt appears to change or confirm the currency after account validation. Additionally, the flow for adding a bank account after validation looks like to Wallet > Add bank account flow, which displays the “Personal bank account added” screen upon completion. However, if the user cancels the add bank account flow after validation and reopens it, the add bank account flow now looks like Workflows > Add bank account and the “Personal bank account added” screen is not shown at the end of the process. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/793ff55b-9158-4dce-b81e-f68802ac20dc [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
